meanings.definition: To cause someone to lose confidence or hope.
meanings.sent1: The harsh criticism demoralized the young student.
meanings.sent2: The team felt demoralized after losing the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The demoralized puppy refused to play fetch, feeling downhearted.
meanings.sent4: The constant failures demoralized him, like a heavy weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The demoralized soldier struggled to find the courage to face the battle.

meanings.definition: To undermine the confidence or morale of someone.
meanings.sent1: The negative comments demoralized her before the big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The constant setbacks demoralized the team, affecting their performance.
meanings.sent3: The demoralized clown couldn't make anyone laugh, feeling disheartened.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal demoralized him, shattering his trust like glass.
meanings.sent5: The demoralized singer forgot the lyrics on stage, feeling defeated.
